comments:
The Creation Time is not correctly set when using the setCreationTime API.
It seems that the problem mostly occurs when importing more log files at once.

The date string passed to the setCreationTime is as follows:

"2005-11-30T14:46:36.000Z"

the console messages show:

Thread[xmlParserThread,6,main] - java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1
	at java.text.DigitList.fitsIntoLong(DigitList.java:181)

Thread[xmlParserThread,6,main] - java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: ""
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:62)

Moreover, even using the tptp log parser to parse cbe log files, in many cases the Creation Time is not correctly set (28-Nov-0028 14:12:50.609000) and some messages like the ones above are shown into the console.

Please,
feel free to contatct me at the email address specified.

Thanks,
Elisabetta
This defect occurs in the loader code for the TPTP Log Model.  As such, transferring to the correct component/owner.
Would you please attach the log file you used to create the problem?

I cannot reproduce the problem in both 4.0.1 and 4.0.1.1 plus drivers. 
Can you attach the file you used or please let me know which log file type you were using?

Hi Elisabetta, I propose to lower the severity and target of this bug to 4.2 for further investigation as the defect is not reproducible in 4.0.1 and 4.1 driver. Please raise if you have any concern regarding this.

Eugene, we have also asked for this fix and I don't object to your proposal. However, please check this defect on the 3.3 code as well. We have (additionally) asked for it to be fixed there if it occurs.
update severity to normal since it can't be reproduceable on the 4.0.* drivers
Problem cannot be reproduced in TPTP 3.3.0 driver neither.

Created an attachment (id=34144)
cbe log files

Hello,
sorry for the delay in answering.
I've just sent you some cbe log files that reproduce the problem on my system.
If that were not enough, I can give you access to my machine.

If you don't mind I have a simple question to which I'm looking for :

- my client is asking me why he can not see the cbe sourceComponentId attribute mapped into a property shown by the GUI. He guesses it's me not setting the sourceComponentId, that I'm obviously setting.
I've also defined an external property to show the sourceComponentId, but he's not satisfied.
He asks me also the same question for the Situation attribute.
Is there any property in the Log File Perspective that show the sourceComponentId and Situation attributes? If yes, how can I see it?


Many thanks,
Elisabetta
